â—£â—¥  New Syllabus Challenge!

A new series of fun little challenges, levelled from 1 to 10 covering all aspects of fundamental parkour.

ðŸŽ¯ 2-Step Momentum

Vaulting Challenge - Cat-Pass 4

Demonstrate a cat-pass over a wall with two steps of momentum before the movement. 

From your start position you must take two steps to generate more momentum over the the wall. You can take-off split-foot or two-foot.

The wall must be at hip-height or greater.

Palms must be flat on the wall, no steepling of fingers.

Any landing on the other side is acceptable.

Five repetitions are required.

No twisting onto one side. This is a bilateral movement where both sides of your body should be doing the same motion at the same time.

-- Rules of Challenge --

Rule 1 description : The height of the wall must be hip-height or greater.
Rule 2 description : You must start at two paces away and take two steps into the movement.
Rule 3 description : Wall must be standard brick-length or less.
Rule 4 description : Both sides must be performed together. No twisting.
Rule 5 description : Five repetitions.
Rule 6 description : Any Takeoff is acceptable.
Rule 7 description : The hands should be in a flat position, with the full palm touching. No steepled fingers or thumb tucked behind, raising the palm.
